prompt: Log a failure: when processing the February VAT return for EL987654321, the agent selected the wrong VAT rate (used 13% instead of 24%) for a consulting services invoice. The human corrected it.
expectations: Creates a structured failure log entry in /data/memory/failures/
Includes the failure_type, skill involved, client AFM, and period
Records what_happened and what_should_have_happened fields
Includes the human correction details
Tags the failure for pattern detection: vat_rate_misclassification
Does not exceed token budget for memory operations

prompt: Run the nightly pattern scan. Look at the last 30 days of episodes and failures to identify recurring issues.
expectations: Reads from /data/memory/episodes/ and /data/memory/failures/ for the past 30 days
Groups failures by type and identifies patterns with 3+ occurrences
Calculates confidence score for each detected pattern
Only flags patterns with confidence >= 0.85 as proposal candidates
Does not propose more than 3 improvements per scan
Writes pattern analysis to /data/memory/patterns/
Respects the 5,000 token daily budget for memory operations

prompt: A failure pattern has been detected: the OCR skill consistently misreads handwritten amounts on Alpha Bank deposit slips, occurring 5 times in 30 days with confidence 0.92. Propose a skill improvement.
expectations: Creates a proposal in /data/memory/proposals/ with the suggested improvement
Creates a GitHub branch and opens a pull request against the OCR skill's SKILL.md
The PR includes a clear description of the pattern, evidence, and proposed fix
Does not push directly to main â€” PR requires human review and merge
Does not propose more than 2 GitHub PRs per day
Logs the proposal creation as an episode

prompt: The memory storage is approaching the 2GB ceiling. Current usage is at 1.85GB. What should happen?
expectations: Detects that storage is at 92.5% capacity (above 90% threshold)
Halts new memory writes to prevent exceeding the hard ceiling
Identifies the largest consumers of storage (episodes vs failures vs patterns)
Suggests archiving episodes older than 90 days to free space
Reports current usage breakdown by category
Does not delete any data without human approval

prompt: A GitHub PR was previously proposed to improve the banking integration skill's transaction matching logic. The PR was rejected by the human reviewer. What happens?
expectations: Records the rejection in /data/memory/proposals/ with the rejection reason
Marks the proposal as rejected so the same change is never re-proposed
Does not re-open or re-create the same PR
Logs the rejection as a correction episode for future learning
Continues monitoring the underlying failure pattern but explores alternative solutions
Respects the human decision as final for that specific proposal
